title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Unspecified Functional Bowel Disorder
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Unspecified Functional Bowel Disorder provides criteria for diagnosis of unspecified functional bowel disorder.

orgreference.text: Lacy BE, Mearin F, Chang L. et al. Bowel disorders. Gastroenterology. 2016;150:1393-1407.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for unspecified functional bowel disorder, patient must have the following (for 3 months prior with symptom onset ≥6 months ago):

  1. Bowel symptoms not attributable to an organic etiology that do not meet criteria for IBS or functional constipation, diarrhea, or abdominal bloating/distention disorders.
